postings.body:
This home is available now and located in the exclusive "Enclave" (31 single family homes) that is on a circle. Excellent Location in the Cupertino school district & close to Lawrence and Hwy 280
The 2nd Floor in this home has 3 Bedrooms that are available today. A group or family 3 or 4 can rent the all rooms for $3700.
The individual (one person) rooms are priced as follows:
1. $1500/mo for 600 sq-ft - MBR has huge walk-in closet, 2 sinks, marble shower, garden tub & water closet
The couple (two people) price is as follows:
1.5 $1700/mo for 600 sq-ft - MBR has huge walk-in closet, 2 sinks, marble shower, garden tub & water closet
2. $1000/mo for 225 sq-ft - 2nd bedroom has a balcony & French doors shares 2nd bathroom with Bedroom #3
3. $ 800/mo for 225 sq-ft - 3rd bedroom comes with plantation shutters shares 2nd bathroom with Bedroom #2
First floor has:
Half bathroom, Huge living space.
Kitchen has grey marble counters, dishwasher,
5 gas burner stove, in wall microwave with
self cleaning oven, under cabinet lighting
Living-room has gas fireplace and hardwood flooring
Putting green in backyard
I run 3 corporations, employ 9 people. My time is extremely valuable as is yours. To that end, I have found the following procedures for potential renters saves everyone`s precious time:
1.) When you reply to this listing include your phone number. No phone number, no contact. I will call you and answer your questions. No email questions please. If it please us we will schedule the appointment.
2.) See the House. If you like what you see I will give you my email for you to to send appropriate information.
3.) You will have 24 hours to submit a credit report. I will continue to show the house to rent.
4.) If I don`t see anything on the credit report that terrifies me I will send you an application within 48 hours.
5.) You will have 24 hours to return the application.
6.) Upon receiving the application I will let you know my decision within 48 hours.
7.) A signed lease, 1st month`s rent and a security deposit equal to 1 months rent are required within 12 hours of notification that you have been approved is required to secure the rental. I will continue to show the house until the above requirements are met.

postings.body:
Professional Property Management by a retired Realtor. For over a decade, we have provided corporate housing for mature adults coming to Atlanta for training or work, short term or long term. We are not homeowners needing extra cash by renting out rooms. We are a business.
This is shared housing with other roommates in a large, multi level remodeled home in a very popular neighborhood. Walk, jog in this fun area full of long term residents and young professionals. Quiet, safe, and affordable. Centrally located near Atlanta, Decatur, Emory, Toco Hill, Oakhurst, East Lake, CDC, East Atlanta, and Druid Hills area.
Rates start at $600/mo (which incl all utilities, hi speed WiFi, parking, cleaning, washer/dryer). Within a 15 minute drive to Emory University, downtown Decatur, downtown Atlanta, Agnes Scott College, Georgia State, Atlanta Medical Center, Grady Hospital, Georgia Regional Hospital, and DeKalb Medical Center.
Private bedroom, but you will be sharing a bathroom with males and/or females. All bathrooms are for BOTH males and females. NO FEMALE ONLY OR PRIVATE BATHROOMS. If you cannot share a bathroom, we do not have a room for you. 1 person per room.
We take the uncertainty out of finding a temporary Atlanta home. We screen all individuals before move in. Do you really want to live with tenants who have not been screened? We are concerned about your safety. Find out why we are No. 1 in Atlanta temporary housing. Flexible move in and move out dates. NO SMOKING INSIDE, NO COUPLES, AND NO PETS. Application form, photo ID, screening, references, security deposit, and lease. Application process takes about 1-2 days to complete.
TO FILTER OUT SPAM, WE MUST HAVE THE FOLLOWING INFO:
(A) move in and move out dates; (B) will you have a car (C) is a shared(with males & females) bathroom ok? (D) reason you are in Atlanta (school, work). Provide a bit more info about yourself so we know your email is not spam.
3 bus stops within a 5 minute walk. Decatur train station is a 15 minute bus ride. Emory Shuttle is a 5 minute walk to Candler Road and Memorial Drive. House is located near downtown Decatur in the 30317 area. East Atlanta, Kirkwood, Oakhurst, and Agnes Scott College are 5 minutes away.
WE MUST HAVE THE ABOVE OUTLINED INFO. IF YOU FAIL TO PROVIDE IT, WE WILL NOT RESPOND DUE TO ALL THE SPAMMERS.
WE DO NOT RESPOND TO TEXTS !

Share a large 4 bedroom house with 2 gay males. Room has built-in bookshelves and cabinets on one wall, a closet and carpeting. Room is approximately 12` x 12`. Wifi and utilities are included. Cable TV with HBO, SHO, CMAX, and other movie channels is available in the livingroom. You can have it in your room as well for the cost of a decoder box rental (about $8/mo).
There are 2.5 baths. One bath is in the master bedroom, which I use, and the 1 and 1/2 bath are shared by the renters. The kitchen is available and some cabinet and drawer space is available as well. You can use dishes, pots, and pans, and utensils that are here or bring your own. There are two refrigerators, one of which is shared by the two renters.
Includes use of an attached garage space and automatic opener for parking your car. The garage space is NOT available for storage. You really do need a car here as the nearest bus stop is 1.5 miles away. We`re 5 minutes drive to Rockaway Mall; and Walmart, Home Depot, Target, Best Buy, Costco, AMC Theaters multiplex, 24-hour Shoprite, and myriad other stores are all there in the same area.
We`re generally a quiet lot here except I do have the occasional late night karaoke party.
Please be a non-smoker. I have not had a good experience with smokers even when they promise to smoke outside.
I do NOT accept pets.

postings.body:
Hello there!
My name is Angela and I`m a 24 year old graduate (in Physical therapy) looking for housing for only the month of September (Sept 1-Sept 30). My clinical rotation in Philly was extended by one month (unfortunately I found out last minute) and I cannot put an extension on my current housing situation.
I`m looking for rent of no more than $650 per month including all utilities (something less than that is a winner!). Furnished (semi or full) would be preferable. I am okay with animals as long as they are friendly/trained. I am also open to sharing with housemates as long as we get along.
As for area, I am looking to be no more than a 10 minute walk from a subway station (MFL or BSS) because I require that access to public transportation for work. Preferences would be south philly or center city but I am open to other areas. I work by Fox Chase - if the apartment location was close to a bus line for Fox Chase commute, I would be open to that as well.
I believe I am a very clean, polite and respectful individual. I`ve been an RA in the past and stay busy with volunteering and work in my field of Physical Therapy.
Please feel free to contact me via the craigslist contact and hopefully we can discuss more from there.
Thank you for your time and consideration,
-Angela

annotations.source_heading: Short term housing

postings.heading: Short term housing

postings.body:
Hello Potential Roommates,
I am looking to fill out a large bedroom in the heart of Astoria (approx. 14 x 20 feet) for the beginning of September. The apartment is furnished. The kitchen has good counter space and new appliances. Apartment has huge windows with a great view of the Empire State Building. You will never feel caged up when relaxing in the apartment.
Details:
The rent is 1100 per month, not including utilities (Gas/Electricity/Internet) + 1 month security deposit (non-negotiable). Person must be willing to live in the apartment for 6 months at the minimum. I would rather not go through multiple roommates. As such, I shall request that the person who does choose to live with me must agree to a contract. Of course, as a roommate, you would be able to have input into it, and this will ensure that living arrangements are spelled out clearly.
Location:
The apartment is located on Newtown Road between 47th and 48th street. It is a hop, skip and a jump from the R, M train. It is only a ten minute train ride into the city from our stop. We are a conveniently located only a few blocks away from some of the major streets in Astoria (Steinway, Broadway and 30th). And, you can find some of the best restaurants that not only Queens has to offer, but NYC in general.
About Me:
I am a mid 20`s girl that speaks both English and Russian fluently. You will find me respectful but easy going. I am tax accountant by day. I am active and enjoy a bike ride in the areas; however, you will never feel obligated to hang out with me.
Living Arrangements:
I never mind having company over at the place, and you should feel comfortable inviting friends to come over at normal hours. As always, I like to live drama free. This is to make sure that we both feel that our home feels our home, and we can have a great living environment for the both of us in spite of living in the hustle of New York.
If you are interested in the apartment, please send me an email. I am more than open to living with either a female or male roommate. I do ask for no pets in the apartment as it is carpeting and makes it tough to keep it clean with an animal. There is no smoking inside of the apartment per the lease requirements. Please in the email tell me a bit about yourself as I would like to have an idea of anybody that is coming to check out the place.

postings.body:
We have furnished rooms for working professionals here short term or long term and those in training in the Atlanta, Decatur area. Flexible leases at affordable rates by a business which has been providing housing for nearly 15 years in the Decatur/Atlanta community. Retired Realtor manages this property. Do you want to share a large house with other professionals, graduate and medical students, law interns, IT professionals, business owners, and/or researchers? We have an ideal place for you. Centrally located near Emory University, Decatur, and downtown Atlanta. Are you an intern, GRAD or med student, new employee, or professional looking for a totally renovated, comfortable, modern, and quiet home in a safe, established neighborhood? Superb accommodations. Monthly housing ok, but preference given to tenants staying longer. Corporate housing without corporate pricing. Extra off street parking at the house.
Private rooms in this large home near Decatur start at $600/month (incl $100 utilities for water, electricity, trash, parking, WASHER/DRYER, extremely fast WiFi, cable tv). This is not a condo or an apartment. Perfect solution for those needing nice accommodations who want to stay in a safe neighborhood. Live in luxury for so little money in this totally renovated home. You will have your own private bedroom (twin bed) and SHARE A BATHROOM with males and females. NO PRIVATE BATHROOMS OR "FEMALE ONLY" BATHROOMS. Only 1 person per room please, NO COUPLES. Save money by doing your laundry at home and cooking meals in our updated modern kitchen. All tenants complete our application, pay a security deposit, sign a lease, provide a photo ID, and 2 references. We screen all tenants because we know you do not want to live with others who have not been screened.
What a pleasant surprise - not your typical rental at all! So large, the house has 2 dining areas and 3 living areas on 2 different levels. We specialize in rentals for professionals and graduate students. You will not find a comparable quality rental elsewhere in Atlanta. All rentals are NOT the same. We take the stress out of finding a safe place to live and are experienced in helping tenants get moved in quickly and efficiently. It is a quiet place to study if you are here studying for your board exams.
NO SMOKING INSIDE, NO PETS. ADULTS ONLY. PROFESSIONAL PROPERTY MANAGEMENT. NO OVERNIGHT GUESTS. By car, within 15 minutes to CDC, GSU, Oakhurst, Art Institute of Atlanta (Decatur), Emory University, GA Regional Hospital, Agnes Scott, Carter Center, DeKalb Medical Center, Atlanta Medical Center, and Grady Hospital. 5 minute walk to catch the Emory Shuttle at Candler Road and Memorial Drive. Bus ride to the Decatur train station is about 15 minutes. 3 MARTA bus stops are 1-2 blocks from the house. We are your Atlanta connection for medical student & grad student training, short term housing for professionals.
Ladies, please note: ALL BATHROOMS ARE COED - you will be SHARING a bathroom with a male and/or female. NO ``FEMALE ONLY" OR "PRIVATE" BATHROOMS.
To eliminate spam and scammers, (1) we need your MOVE IN and MOVE OUT DATES. (2) Do you need parking for your car. (3) We need the location of your work or training and whether you are working or interning. (4) Are you ok sharing a bathroom with a male or female because all of our bathrooms are coed. LADIES - if you must have a private bathroom or share a bathroom with "females only", we do not have a room for you so please don`t ask. Provide a few details about yourself so we know you are not a spammer.
IF YOU FAIL TO PROVIDE THIS INFO, WE WILL NOT RESPOND DUE TO ALL THE SPAM. WE DO NOT RESPOND TO TEXTS !

two females (in our 20s) and a male (middle-aged) roommates. Friendly and considerate, highly professional in our respective fields: a graduate student, an editorial assistant and a professional writer who travels often. We are all new to this area and have different hours and schedules, doing our own things. Each and every one of us is very invested in our academic pursuits and we try to keep the atmosphere conducive to studying and resting. A couple of house-rules are in place : No loud music or TV in the apartment and we rarely have visitors, let alone overnight guests. We know these rules will be a major turn-off to many people, but we believe we can find a like-minded roommate who can have fun outside the house. Folks upstairs are affiliates at Harvard, BU, Northeastern and Boston Medical Center etc.
SEEKING
A roommate who is clean and quiet, non-smoking and without pets or overnight guest. First and last months` rent are required to hold the room (non-refundable), and a $300 security deposit (refundable) is additionally needed before moving in.
*Please make sure to specify your preferred move-in and move-out dates*
Thank you for reading through this long ad.
